General.preQuizText:
What value is there to clearn communication in the workplace? Take this quiz to find out.

For each statement, choose whether the statement is likely or unlikely for you.

Questions.questionText: In my future career, I will be asked to read various kinds of text.

answers.feedBack: You're not alone. Most jobs in today's information economy require us to read a variety of written styles. You may be asked read a patient's medica history, a memo from the company president on policy changes, or an instructional document outlineing expectations and plans for a project you are working on.

Although many jobs rely on primarily on a set of practical skills, most also have a reading component embedded somewhere in the workday.

Can you imagine being asked to read a patient's medical history, a memo from the company president on policy change, or an instructional document outlining expectations and plans for a project you are working on?

Even if you are not likely to encounter an academic essay or full-length book in the course of your job, you are likely to call upon your critical reading skills in a variety of situations.

Questions.questionText: When I am employed in my career of choice, I will be asked to communicate my point of view.

answers.feedBack: Incorrect! That isn't Scout's real name.
Incorrect! That isn't Scout's real name.

Questions.hintText: Known to mimic the songs of other birds.
